heading: 3. (1) Where the National Regulatory Authority is satisfied that it requires
text_raw:
3. (1) Where the National Regulatory Authority is satisfied that it requires 
information or data in order to carry out its tasks under EMFA it may make a 
request in writing for such information or data to – 

(a) 

(b) 

any person to whom Chapter III of EMFA applies, or 

any other person that, for purposes related to his, her or its trade, 
business or profession, might reasonably be in possession of such 
information or data. 

(2) The National Regulatory Authority shall set out in a request under 

paragraph (1) – 

(a) 

the reasons why the information or data concerned is – 

(i) 

necessary, and

(ii) proportionate, 

and 

(b) 

the period of time within which the information or data is to be 
provided. 

(3) A person who receives a request under this Regulation shall provide the 
information or data requested to the National Regulatory Authority within the 
period specified in the request. 

(4) A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to provide the 
information or data as requested under this Regulation shall be guilty of an 
offence and shall be liable, on summary conviction, to a class A fine. 

(5) Summary proceedings for an offence under this Regulation may be 

brought by the National Regulatory Authority.

title: full effect to Regulation (EU) 2024/1083 of the European Parliament and of the
heading: 4. The Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) is amended –
text_raw:
4. The Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) is amended – 

(a) 

in section 2(1), by the insertion of the following definition: 

“ ‘EMFA’ means Regulation (EU) 2024/1083 of the European Parliament and 
of the Council of 11 April 20245 establishing a common framework for media 
services in the internal market and amending Directive 2010/13/EU (European 
Media Freedom Act);”, 

(b) 

in section 32 – 

(i) 

(ii) 

in subsections (1) and (2), by the insertion of “including its 
functions under the Directive and any task assigned to it by 
or under Chapter III of EMFA,” after “its functions”, and 

in subsection (3), by the substitution of “European Board 
for Media Services established under Article 8 of EMFA” 
for “European Regulators Group for Audiovisual Media 
Services established by Article 30b(1) of the Directive”, 

(c) 

(d) 

in section 159B(4)(b), by the substitution of “European Board for 
Media Services established under Article 8 of EMFA” for 
“European Regulators Group for Audiovisual Media Services 
established by Article 30b of the Directive”, and 

in section 159C(5)(e), by the substitution of “European Board for 
Media Services established under Article 8 of EMFA” for 
“European Regulators Group for Audiovisual Media Services 
established by Article 30b of the Directive”.
